--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Derek James <blue5432@y...> wrote:

> I'm wondering who is now actively working with NEAT,
> or a close variant, and then, if you're not currently,
> who might be interested in working with NEAT in the
> future.
> 

Hey Derek, I work with NEAT!  Just kidding...but I wanted
to ask you about your project...

> For those who haven't scoured the archives yet, I'm
> Derek James, the moderator of the group.  Philip
> Tucker (also on this list) and I are working on a Java
> implementation of NEAT that we hope to opensource in
> the near future.  We're primarily interested in board
> game domains, specifically the Gomoku/Renju/Go class
> of games, but also to a lesser degree, other game
> domains and real-time robot control.
> 

So do you foresee your system being used by people 
with little expertise who want
to be able to quickly set up experiments, or more
by serious researchers setting up very efficient 
distributed experiments?  In other words, are you
trying to have an easy-to-use interface?

ken
